title: Slides | Silvia Canel√≥n
text:
readr: info


OverviewCheatsheetReading





Importing data is the very first step!
You can use readr to import rectangular data.

You can import‚Ä¶

comma separated (CSV) files with read_csv()
tab separated files with read_tsv()
general delimited files with read_delim()
fixed width files with read_fwf()
tabular files where columns are separated by white-space with read_table()
web log files with read_log()






 PDF: https://github.com/rstudio/cheatsheets/raw/main/data-import.pdf 








R for Data Science: Ch 11 Data import
Package documentation: https://readr.tidyverse.org/

title: Slides | Silvia Canel√≥n
text:
readr: exercise


Read data inSave data


Both options below will get you the same dataset!
Option 1

# option 1: load using URL ----
raw_adelie_url <- read_csv("https://portal.edirepository.org/nis/dataviewer?packageid=knb-lter-pal.219.3&entityid=002f3893385f710df69eeebe893144ff")

Option 2

# option 2: load using filepath ----
raw_adelie_filepath <- read_csv("tutorial/raw_adelie.csv")





Lucky for us, the palmerpenguins üì¶ compiles data from all three species together for us!
penguins contains a clean dataset

penguins <- 
  palmerpenguins::penguins 

head(penguins)
## # A tibble: 6 √ó 8
##   species island    bill_length_mm bill_depth_mm flipper_l‚Ä¶¬π body_‚Ä¶¬≤ sex    year
##   <fct>   <fct>              <dbl>         <dbl>       <int>   <int> <fct> <int>
## 1 Adelie  Torgersen           39.1          18.7         181    3750 male   2007
## 2 Adelie  Torgersen           39.5          17.4         186    3800 fema‚Ä¶  2007
## 3 Adelie  Torgersen           40.3          18           195    3250 fema‚Ä¶  2007
## 4 Adelie  Torgersen           NA            NA            NA      NA <NA>   2007
## 5 Adelie  Torgersen           36.7          19.3         193    3450 fema‚Ä¶  2007
## 6 Adelie  Torgersen           39.3          20.6         190    3650 male   2007
## # ‚Ä¶ with abbreviated variable names ¬π‚Äãflipper_length_mm, ¬≤‚Äãbody_mass_g




penguins_raw contains raw data

penguins_raw <- 
  palmerpenguins::penguins_raw

head(penguins_raw)
## # A tibble: 6 √ó 17
##   study‚Ä¶¬π Sampl‚Ä¶¬≤ Species Region Island Stage Indiv‚Ä¶¬≥ Clutc‚Ä¶‚Å¥ `Date Egg` Culme‚Ä¶‚Åµ
##   <chr>     <dbl> <chr>   <chr>  <chr>  <chr> <chr>   <chr>   <date>       <dbl>
## 1 PAL0708       1 Adelie‚Ä¶ Anvers Torge‚Ä¶ Adul‚Ä¶ N1A1    Yes     2007-11-11    39.1
## 2 PAL0708       2 Adelie‚Ä¶ Anvers Torge‚Ä¶ Adul‚Ä¶ N1A2    Yes     2007-11-11    39.5
## 3 PAL0708       3 Adelie‚Ä¶ Anvers Torge‚Ä¶ Adul‚Ä¶ N2A1    Yes     2007-11-16    40.3
## 4 PAL0708       4 Adelie‚Ä¶ Anvers Torge‚Ä¶ Adul‚Ä¶ N2A2    Yes     2007-11-16    NA  
## 5 PAL0708       5 Adelie‚Ä¶ Anvers Torge‚Ä¶ Adul‚Ä¶ N3A1    Yes     2007-11-16    36.7
## 6 PAL0708       6 Adelie‚Ä¶ Anvers Torge‚Ä¶ Adul‚Ä¶ N3A2    Yes     2007-11-16    39.3
## # ‚Ä¶ with 7 more variables: `Culmen Depth (mm)` <dbl>,
## #   `Flipper Length (mm)` <dbl>, `Body Mass (g)` <dbl>, Sex <chr>,
## #   `Delta 15 N (o/oo)` <dbl>, `Delta 13 C (o/oo)` <dbl>, Comments <chr>, and
## #   abbreviated variable names ¬π‚ÄãstudyName, ¬≤‚Äã`Sample Number`, ¬≥‚Äã`Individual ID`,
## #   ‚Å¥‚Äã`Clutch Completion`, ‚Åµ‚Äã`Culmen Length (mm)`
